column4: i wass here last nighht trying to get help getting version 100.10 installed on my son's laptop. need more help please
we installed ddesktop x32 10.10 on his laptop and we do not get the gui desktop when we boot up
it goes to a terminal prompt and we can't seem to get it to go any furthher
tried to install netbook version from a usb but it was unable to initialize the usb drive
how do we get the commputer to boot to the desktop?
how do we get it to let us down load the updates and upgrades that it kept timing out on last night
is there something that we didn't do when we were installing the program thaat explains why it is not going to the desktop?
this is my first exposure to ubuntu and linux so I need some help please
do you get to the login screen, or just terminal, did you install nvidia drivers maybe ..., how old is that laptop?
i've been playing with an older laptop for few days now, still cant fix the graphics, btw
what about glxinfo | grep vendor
hmm, should be installed i think
how about lshw | grep VGA
'lshw | grep VGA'
enter the command exactly as posted it should return just the VGA part, two lines max
just one line or what?
2nd line here is like: product: ION VGA [GeForce 9400M]
sounds like partitioning tool, i thought you have ubuntu installed allready...
are you attempting some dual-boot or ubuntu only?
how did you partition the drive(s)?
to me it sound like a borken install, i'd do a clean reinstall and make sure to wipe the HD clean
on a laptop with 4gb ram and 500 gb new hard drive should I use netbook or desktop version and should I use version 10.04 or 10.10
10.10 desktop (i wouldnt bother with netbook)
